chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark W Girton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark W Girton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark W Girton was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • Mark W Girton was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: PERTAINS TO BOTH COUNTS: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Not go armed with any weapons. Complete GED or equivalent. No contact co-defendants. No contact Top Hat Motel. No contact victim J.S. Maintain full-time employment, school or treatment. Anger management at agent's discretion. Probation review in nine months. State does not object to early discharge from probation, after three years.

records.addlTxt: Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by ADA Genda

Defendant Mark W Girton in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Christine Marie Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2&3 of Amended Information to be filed.  Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld on count 2, 4 years probation, conds: 4 months jail commence forth with. No Huber.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Defendant to submit DNA sample. Not go armed with any weapons. Complete GED or equivalent. No contact co-defendants. No contact Top Hat Motel. No contact victim J.S. Maintain full-time employment, school or treatment. Anger management at agent's discretion $518 costs. Probation review in nine months. State does not object to early discharge from probation, after three years. On count 3, sentence withheld, 1 year probation, $243 costs. Jail credit to be determined. Ct. 1 dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
